celldancer.velocityÂ¶

celldancer.velocity(cell_type_u_s, gene_list=None, max_epoches=200, check_val_every_n_epoch=10, patience=3, learning_rate=0.001, dt=0.5, n_neighbors=30, permutation_ratio=0.125, speed_up=True, norm_u_s=True, norm_cell_distribution=True, loss_func='cosine', n_jobs=- 1, save_path=None)Â¶

Velocity estimation for each cell.

Parameters

  • cell_type_u_s (pandas.DataFrame) â Dataframe that contains the unspliced abundance, spliced abundance, embedding space, and cell type information. Columns=[âgene_nameâ, âunspliceâ, âspliceâ ,âcellIDâ ,âclustersâ ,âembedding1â ,âembedding2â]

  • gene_list (optional, list (default: None)) â Gene list for velocity estimation. None if to estimate the velocity of all genes.

  • max_epoches (optional, int (default: 200)) â Stop to update the network once this number of epochs is reached.

  • check_val_every_n_epoch (optional, int (default: 10)) â Check loss every n train epochs.

  • patience (optional, int (default: 3)) â Number of checks with no improvement after which training will be stopped.

  • dt (optional, float (default: 0.5)) â Step size

  • permutation_ratio (optional, float (default: 0.125)) â Sampling ratio of cells in each epoch when training each gene.

  • speed_up (optional, bool (default: True)) â True if speed up by downsampling cells. False if to use all cells to train the model.

  • norm_u_s (optional, bool (default: True)) â True if normalize unsplice (and splice) reads by dividing max value of unspliced (and spliced) reads.

  • norm_cell_distribution (optional, bool (default: True)) â True if the bias of cell distribution is to be removed on embedding space (many cells share the same position of unspliced (and spliced) reads).

  • loss_func (optional, str (default: cosine)) â Currently support âcosineâ, ârmseâ, and (âmixâ, mix_ratio).

  • n_jobs (optional, int (default: -1)) â The maximum number of concurrently running jobs.

  • save_path (optional, str (default: 200)) â Path to save the result of velocity estimation.

Returns

  • loss_df (pandas.DataFrame) â The record of loss.

  • cellDancer_df (pandas.DataFrame) â The result of velocity estimation.
